description:
Summary score for the Pediatric Sleep Questionnaire. It is the number of items with a positive answer ("yes") divided by the total number of items answered. The score, ranging 0-1, above 0.33 is considered positive and suggestive of high risk for a pediatric sleep-related breathing disorder. [Chervin et al, 2000 (PubMed ID: 10733617)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/10733617)

[Search for all PSQ variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/chat/variables?search=psq)
calculation: 100*( PSL1A + PSL1B + PSL1C + PSL1D + PSL1E + PSL2 + PSL3A + PSL3B + PSL3C + PSL4A + PSL4B + PSL5 + PSL6 + PSL7 + PSL8 + PSL9 + PSL10A + PSL10B + PSL10C + PSL10D + PSL10E + PSL10F)/(22 - nmiss)
